column1:
Okay, let's get to Leblanc posthaste. I wonder
how the chief's been getting along...

I'm exhausted from all the excitement today.
Let's call it a night and get some sleep.

Hey, were you having trouble sleeping last
night, [1B]S1? You were tossing
and turning like crazy.

Anyway, it's time for us to meet up with Ryuji
and buy our share of the camping equipment.
Let's head over to the Buchiko statue.

Looks like everyone's out gathering intel
already. Let's not fall behind!
All right, our job's to finish up preparations for the heist while the calling card's completed.
Once that's finished and delivered, we have to complete the heist in one fell swoop.

Mm, Makoto's got a good point. Should we
gather everyone up?

Okay, let's get our supplies. What say we start
with the closest destination and head to Takemi
Medical Clinic?

Aw, c'mon dude... Aight, lemme know if you
change your mind.
What are we waitin' for, then!?

You're gonna go right now!? I think you're a little
obsessed...

Man, could today have been any more
drama-packed?
About to roll out?
Yeah, see you later.
Not just yet.

Let's head out as soon as we're ready. Make sure
you leave nothing undone.

That a problem? Hey, if you're not
doin' anything, you should come with.

All right, just make sure you get everything
you'll need.

Ah, Yongen-Jaya... We may have been gone
for only half a year, but it sure brings back
memories.

Whoa, Shibuya's as busy as ever. Look at all
the people!

Let's get to the Buchiko statue right away—
we don't want to leave Ryuji alone with his
attention span for too long.
Hmm... I dunno if I want all the calories...

Doesn't seem like the statue's this way...
We should head back.

All right. Well, here—take this with you.
Hope it does you some good on the trip.
Make sure you make enough for everyone.

Well, time for me to pick up your ride. I'll be
right back; you give everyone a call and have
'em meet you here.

Well, I guess I'll come along, since
[1B]S1 is here.
It's time to square off with Alice directly. Once you think we're ready, let's infiltrate that Jail!

Check out the guy with the brown hair.
Wasn't he at Alice's thing?
Let's do it.
I want to sniff out more rumors.

All right, then let's go meet up at the connecting
bridge.
Sure thing, it's your call.

Once you're done, we should get everyone
together at the Shibuya Station's connecting
bridge and go over what we've learned.

Should we do some sightseeing while we wait?
Though it is kinda late, I guess...
Let's indeed.
I'm not done seeing the sights.

Well, we solved the problem in Sapporo. The
question now is, what comes next?

It doesn't seem like we'll be making much
progress until Zenkichi gets back...

I get that. Once you're ready, let's head over
to that signing.

At this hour, I would recommend the Ferris
wheel over in Suzushino.
Think we should head back?
I'm done for now.
Let's keep exploring.

All right, tomorrow's the big day. Let's see
what kind of person Hyodo really is.

All right. Let's go back to the camper when
you're done.

Ooh, that's a good idea! You should go invite
someone to come along!

There's a Ferris wheel around here? That sounds
like fun! Let's do it!
Yo, is Gramps back yet?

It would be nice if we could look around the city
in the meantime... What are your plans?

Are you guys gonna ride the Ferris wheel
together?

A ride on the Ferris wheel with just the guys...
I feel like our bonds will grow stronger.
Let's do it.
I'll ask someone else.

I heard Mari-san's questioning is going to take a
bit longer.
I rested up early for tomorrow...
Are you gonna ride the Ferris wheel with Haru?

Oh, [1B]S1. Looks like we finally have
time to relax a little.
Are you gonna ride the Ferris wheel with Lady Ann?
Good evening. How are things?
Are you gonna ride the Ferris wheel with Makoto?

There's nothing to do 'til Zenkichi gets back...
You got any plans?
Are you gonna ride the Ferris wheel with Futaba?
It's gotten pretty late. I wonder if everyone else is still out having fun...
We're having a celebration!? Ooh, leave it to Lady Ann! That was really thoughtful of her to invite everyone!

But the meet-up isn't for another hour... We've
still got a bit of time until then. What should we
do?
Here, take it. My treat.
It's a can of Manta...

Just a little somethin' to start us off right.
Here's to gettin' back in action!

I might be a bit outta shape right now, but I'll
bounce back in no time!

All right, we're countin' on ya! Lemme know
when you're ready for some Jail action.

How about visiting Tenboto? I'd enjoy seeing the
city from up high.
Ooh, now that you mention it, yeah, we haven't gone up there yet, have we? Let's invite someone to go with us!

The return of the Phantom Thieves is one
thing, but never in a million years would
I have expected to actually fight Alice...

But we have to stop her before she's past
the point of no return.

Let's get this taken care of so we can get on
with our summer vacation!

That Jail... It was eerie just how similar to the
Palaces it was.

If it was similarly created by a human heart,
I can't help but shiver at the thought of
how that person sees the world.
Did it upset you?
We have to fix this.
I'm excited to go back.

Actually, it's rather the opposite. To actually
bear witness to such a warped mind is very
stimulating.

Indeed—and returning there will offer me
yet another chance to bear witness to such
mesmerizing sights.

Ha! I could very well say the same. I must
admit, I'm quite excited to be fighting alongside
everyone once more.

You sure do march to the beat of your own
drum, Yusuke. I'm relieved to see your
personal troubles are well behind you.
I am still rather plagued with problems...

This suffocating heat refuses to cede my attention
and allow me to focus on my art! Even stripping
bare naked doesn't abate the intensity.

Despite my concerns of heatstroke, I cannot
afford air conditioning. My sole saviors are tap
water and the salt stockpile I've maintained.

But I shan't let summer defeat me. My frugality
cannot be stopped!
Please don't die on us, Yusuke...

Ah, right—I now recall your attic room also lacks
air conditioning, [1B]S1.

Here, this could benefit you at some point.
No need to be modest.

If you don't care to crush it up and use it with a
drink, you can even resort to licking it. May this
rock salt be the secret to our success in the Jail!

Man, that's a load off my shoulders. Feels like
now I can give 110% to just kickin' back and
havin' a good time.
What's the haps, chaps? Pickin' up supplies?

I'm workin' on my Crowd Mode right now...
All those Shadows in the Jail were really
starting to get to me.

I figure I'll be more used to them if I observe
their real-world versions more? Maybe? Eh,
it's worth a shot.

Don't sweat too much getting ready! Give us
a call when it's infiltration time!

...You mean to say you weren't already? I would
have guessed you were in this solely for the fun
of it.
I still can't get over just how useful EMMA is.

Just now for me, it put together an entire meal,
gave me its nutritional breakdown, and even
showed me the closest place with ingredients.

All I had to do was ask what I should do about
dinner. Pretty easy to see why people are
such fans...

But then I remember that this app is what lets us
get into the Metaverse... and I get creeped out
all over again.

Gimme a break, man, I just... Look, I just like
goin' all out, okay?
Let's go.
Maybe not.
Oh, [1B]S1. You busy?

Are you gonna go to Tenboto with Lady Ann and
the others?

I wanna get a picture in this cutout board before
we head out!

This is a great photo-op, so it'd be a real waste
not to.

I've gone ahead and called Inari over, too, so you
should join in!
Oh, is it picture time?

What's the plan? Are you gonna hang out with
Futaba?
Sure.
We should get going.

Hey, thanks! Then, let's start makin' some
memories!

What's your hurry? Let me know if you feel like it
later, okay?
There's a Ferris wheel!? Where at!?

I thought I was already concerned about how
things were going in the city, but... now that
I know this is all part of some Jail?

And I don't even want to consider how all these
people are Shadows in that Jail...
That does sound fun. Lead the way.

Oh, a Ferris wheel. That sounds like fun. Shall we
go, then?

Huwha? They've got a Ferris wheel here!? We
gotta go!
A Ferris wheel...? Of course, I'd love to!
Oof... I definitely gained weight after that...

Okay, let's go surf the web and track down some
useful intel.

Oh man... Easy on the road, or else it's all comin'
back up...

Yup. I think we can enter the Jail safely
from here.
Want to head in?
Let's go.
We're not prepared.
This'll be our third Jail. Let's not get sloppy.

Okay. Then just come back once preparations
are made.

Regardless, we still have some time until the
celebration. Should we head somewhere for the
time being?
...You wanna go to Tenboto with these guys?

Tenboto, you say? I would very much like to see
it for myself.
Hell yeah! Let's get goin', then!

We were thinking of just getting some tea and
chatting to pass the time...

We only have time to make maybe one more
stop before the celebration.
Great idea, [1B]S1!
All right, let's go together, then.

Let's get ready for any sort of combat that
might get thrown our way. After that, it's
back to the hideout.

We're not letting them arrest [1B]S1
EVER again.

Indeed. We've no choice but to stop Alice's
rampage, but it's even more crucial that we
keep our good friend out of prison.

Yeah—that's why we're winning this fight,
no matter what.

That Inspector Hasegawa... He's not going to be
easy to deal with.

Right, he'll jump on the first weak point he
finds. We have to watch our words and stay
on our best behavior, more so than ever.

I'm going over the infiltration plan in my head
now. The more I rehearse it, the more confident
I feel.

Hey, no worries, [1B]S1! You're not
getting arrested under our watch.

We'll go take care of Alice, clear your name,
bing, bang, boom! All's well that ends well.
It's the door to the Velvet Room...

I may need her assistance again.
I should probably go talk to her...

I should go to the
Velvet Room first...

It'll be at you-know-where. Let's celebrate for
gettin' the band back together and settin' off on
this big trip!
Let's go.

So, this is Mt. Aoba Park? I like it. A nice, refined
little place—it's even got a shrine.

All right, let's go check out Date Masamune's
statue. It's supposed to be near here.

That Ango Natsume... We may not have any
evidence of him being a Monarch yet, but he
sure is fishy.

Let's get back to the camper. We should work
out how we want to gather intel on him, then
we can go from there.

So we've got ourselves a mobile hideout!
Pretty convenient!

And I've gotta say, it sure does make the
Phantom Thieves even cooler! Nyeheheh...

Once you think everyone's good and ready,
let's meet at the hideout and infiltrate the Jail.
We're counting on you, [1B]S1.

Tomorrow's our final siege on Natsume's castle.
We need to be good and ready for whatever he
may throw at us.

Well, let's hit the RV once you're good and
ready.

Then, the Phantom Thieves begin the search
for Gatorre Coffee.

All right, today we storm the castle! Once we're
ready, let's move out!

Looks like everyone's headed back to the
camper. We should go too, [1B]S1.

Next stop, Hokkaido! Time to say, "Goodbye,
Sendai."

Anything you didn't tick off your list yet while
we're still here? This is your last chance.

We've got plenty of intel now. I'd say it's safe to
call it quits.

Remember Natsume's autograph session we
heard about? This is our chance to see him in
person. Let's do some first-party reconnaissance.

We're getting everyone together? Okay,
I'll contact them for you.

Thanks, Sophia. We should get over there
ourselves.
We'll know if she's a Monarch or not by entering her keyword on EMMA.

Let's go to bed early today and be ready for
tomorrow.
Oh, [1B]S1. Did you get my message?

...Um, this might seem kinda out of nowhere,
but do you like sweets?
I'm not the biggest fan.
Love 'em.
I'm master of all sweets.
Oh... Well, there're lots of different kinds, so you might find something you like if you keep looking.
Really? Oh, perfect!

You like them that much!? Why have you never
told me!?

So, this really isn't a big deal or anything, but
Sendai's got these regional specialty sweets,
right?
I figured, since we're here, we should try as many new things as we can. Well, it turns out there's a lot more to try than I thought.

I doubt we have enough time to get to them all.
So now I'm not sure which ones to go for...
It looks like Lady Ann's sent you a request.

It's not really the kind of request you'd make to
the Phantom Thieves, though...
But we can't let Lady A-... I mean, we can't let our friend down. We should lend her a hand!
Whoa, you actually bought them!

They all look so good... Let's split them up and
eat them as a group later!

...Sorry to put out such a selfish request. Sweets
just kinda brighten the mood, don't you think?
*sigh* Did you see her smile...?

Hey, [1B]S1! I want to see Lady Ann
smile brighter than ever before!
I can help with that.
Sounds like a drag.
Let's make a deal.
Hey, all right! I knew you'd understand.

Come on, don't be like that... I need your help
here.
Sure! Anything to see Lady Ann smile!

...Here's a thought, do you think we can find
something even more amazing than the stuff we
just got for her?

Even more amazing... So super amazing, then.
I've got it. Let me do a search.
Ooh, thanks, Sophia!

...Sweets found. I've got hits of an extremely
limited quantity of a parfait that some have
even called "legendary."
Legendary!?
It's called... the Zunda Supreme Parfait.
Perfect, Sophia! Where do we find it?

...Unfortunately, there aren't any details as to its
exact location. There are only reports that it's
been seen in Mt. Aoba Park.

If it's an extremely limited quantity item, I'll bet
you can probably count the number of people
who've bought it on one hand...
Oh, my darling... Where did I go wrong?
*gasp* It couldn't be...!

Was it when we went to eat that Zunda Supreme
Parfait together?

Was it because I couldn't get through to that
fussy manager?
I had no idea at the time! Who knew you needed a password for a parfait!?

After all my frantic searching, I finally figured it
out. It's "zunda shiro."

But it doesn't matter anymore, not without you
here... Oh, my sweet honey pie...
Hey, did you hear that?

It sounds like he's lost his "honey pie."
Regardless, "zunda shiro" should give us access
to our legendary dessert.

Password...? I'm sorry, I don't know anything
about that.

Oh, the Zunda Supreme Parfait? I saw someone
buy one at a café around here.
Ooh! We have a lead!

Apparently, it's not on their official menu,
though. And you can't just order one, either.
You can't just order it? Is there some kind of trick?
The Zunda Supreme Parfait...?

Oh, I think I heard one of the visitors at the
shrine mention that name.

That said, I think the manager has to specially
acknowledge you or something...

This is Odori Park. It's famous for its fountain
and TV tower.
The bathhouse is in a place called Suzushino.

It should only be a short walk away from here,
so let's get going.

Looks like there's all kinds of people here.
Meaning there are all kinds of rumors, too.

What we want is any kind of info that points to
Mariko Hyodo being a Monarch. Let's go.
All right, we've gathered plenty of information.

The situation is similar to Shibuya and Sendai.
The more we hear, the more suspicious Hyodo
becomes.

If she's giving out her keyword during speeches
as Zenkichi says...
Ready for bed?
Yeah.
Not yet.
I wonder what kind of speech Hyodo's gonna make tomorrow...
Okay, but don't forget about tomorrow. Let's head back to the camper when you're done.

It's been a wild ride, but now we're even closer
to the truth.

Did something happen to Yusuke? We might
wanna go find him!
Morning, [1B]S1. Get any sleep last night?

Today, we breach the castle. Make sure you're
well-prepared.
The accident happened in Odori Park.

Then let's gather at the hideout first and head
over. There should be a warden guarding the
place, if the last few times is any indication.
Don't skimp on the prepwork, [1B]S1.
Where've you been?

Zenkichi's gonna send out the calling card.
Let's have a meeting at the hideout once
you're ready.

So now we're facing Hyodo herself. Be ready for
anything!

*sigh* We'll be saying goodbye to this beautiful
place far too soon...

You sure there's nothing left you wanna do?
Once you board the boat, there's no coming
back.

Man, I can't find even one Okinawa-style
soba shop...
Will you take this seriously?

Oh hey, sorry. I can't help but stare at that
ocean.

Getting to take it easy in a place like this would
be so nice...

I heard there's even a great public beach
nearby. I hope we have time to check it out!

The grandeur of its profile! The dynamism of its
lines!
Oh dear... He's totally in the zone now.

It's hard to imagine something untoward could
be taking place on such a magnificent isle.

I tried questioning the shopkeepers, but they
were all very evasive.

This island isn't too large, though—we should
be able to divide up and perform a thorough
search...

The endless skies and ocean, the pleasant
crashing of the waves, the scent of fresh fruit
wafting along the wind...

This is no mere tourist attraction. This is truly
a natural paradise.
And LOOK at this Shiisaa!

Chinsuko, umibudo, irabu... What should I get
as a souvenir?
Oh, I'm sorry! I should get back on track.

I came across a group of outgoing locals,
so I asked them a few questions...

Once I told them I was from Tokyo, they gave
me all this produce!

Those are called bitter melons, or "goya" in
Okinawan.

Right! The locals told me they were picked just
this morning. Look how bright they are! I bet
they're delicious.

Perhaps we could try cooking something with
these? I'd love to watch you work your magic.

Everyone here's so friendly and cheerful. You
really don't come across too many people like
that in the city.

But nobody's admitted to knowing anything
about a lab on the island. Could they be less
outgoing than they seem...?

These are divine guardians, said to stave off
disasters. Apparently, the one on the right is
male, while the left one is female.

Ah, so they're a couple! Good lookin' out,
Mr. and Mrs. Shiisaa!

OMG, Shiisaa Alert! I've never seen one in real
life!

Whoa, look how detailed they are from close
up! And they all have different expressions!
Oh, hey.

I overheard from some deliveryman that
there's a really big building just this way.
Wow, look at that path.

We ought to come back here once you're done
exploring.

Looks like Zenkichi found something—should
we check it out?
Now that we're all rested up and ready to go...

We can finally storm that castle. Let's all
meet up at the hideout once preparations
are complete.

Looks like everyone's gone off to do their own
thing. Why don't you see the sights for a bit?

You could also address any open Jail requests.
If you wish to do so, just pop into the hideout.

This could be your last bit of free time on the
trip. Make sure you don't leave with any regrets.
Let's do it.
I need a moment.

Great! Sophia, ring 'em up and get 'em over
here!
Okay, I've got it.

Okay, I can message everyone once you're
ready.

Yo, sorry for the wait. Thank goodness there
wasn't any traffic, huh?

...I've got a real bad feeling about this. We
need to head out for the tower as soon as
you're ready.
Please choose a skill to inherit.
Is this Persona acceptable?
Is this the power you seek?
You wish to add this Persona to the registry?
Go ahead.
Never mind.

I will register all Personas in your possession.
Is that acceptable?

Now we're in Suzushino, which is apparently a
haven for pedestrians around this time.

I wonder why it's so crowded, though.
Everybody's talking about voting...

Well, no matter. Back to the bathhouse. Just go
straight for a bit, then take a right and you'll be
there.
Everyone took off...

We should get going ourselves and see if we
can track down this research lab.

Oh, the sun's setting... So, what should we do
next?
Hmm?

Wow, look at all these food vendors! This really
is the kitchen of Japan!

Well, Sophia? Did you find us a good entrance
to the Jail?

Sure did—the safest entrance is near Tenboto
in Shinsekai.
Looks like we've reached Shinsekai.

Look at the fish swimming through the air!
And that big, gleaming statue! What purpose
could they serve?

What an interesting place! Looks like there's
a ton of stores to check out, too.

And what's with that crowd? Are they trying to
get at that statue?
There you are, [1B]S1.

Hmm? What's wrong, [1B]S1?
Did you "zone out"?

The safest entry point of the Jail is near
Tenboto. Let's go.

Hmm, based on the voices, it's pretty clear
we're headed to Konoe's childhood home...
Zenkichi's tracking the address down now.

Considering what we've seen so far, we're
probably going to run across a warden there.

Let's make sure we're as ready as we can be,
then meet up with Zenkichi at the hideout.
Oh, that's the...

Make sure you get it all done. Once you're
ready, let's take the RV back to the port.
Can I help you...?

Ah, you're here for the Zunda Supreme Parfait?
Then, please provide the password.
All right, [1B]S1! Let her have it!
...My, excitable little kitty, isn't he?
I gave the manager the password...
...Excellent.

"Zunda shiro" is a legendary type of soybean,
born from many years of selective breeding.
That is the meaning of the password.

Oh...? Looking closer, I can see that you have the
eyes of a true hunter, and one who always
ensnares his sweet, sweet prey.

Those glasses can't hide your passion for sweets
from me. No, sir.

...Very well. The Zunda Supreme Parfait is yours
to purchase.
Wow! You did it, [1B]S1!
Do we just buy it at the counter? C'mon, let's not waste any time!
Hey, your phone's buzzing.
I'll contact Ann once you've marked the request as fulfilled on your phone.
Looks like we had no problem purchasing it.

I'll contact Ann once you've marked the request
as fulfilled on your phone.

And what about getting ourselves prepared
before entering?
Should we gather everyone and get started?
Hey, you don't have enough ingredients.

Shujin Academy... I never would've thought
we'd be going back there under these
circumstances.

We really ought to have Futaba poke around
in Sophia once we have the time for it.

If we're entering the Jail through Shujin, we
have no idea what we'll find on the other side.

Let's make sure we're all good with the
supplies and equipment before diving in.

Once you're ready, we should join up with
everyone at the hideout—that way, we can
all go to Shujin together.

Done getting ready? For what? Well... I guess
there's no need to be on edge the WHOLE time
we're here.
Oh, I know!

We set it up so people can send requests to your
phone, didn't we?
There! Sent!

Hm, hmm～ Ohhh, what's that, [1B]S1?
I think someone sent you something.

You should probably accept that request right
away! I think whoever sent it would be really
happy if you helped them out!
Gatorre Coffee, huh?

If that ends up being the entrance to the Trauma
Room, we could find ourselves face-to-face with
another real threat, like last time...

There's nothing more we can do now.
We should wait at the hideout until
Zenkichi reaches out.

Osaka's known for lots of things, but laughter is
definitely one of them.
Hey, there you are.

Y'know how we got our fight with Konoe pretty
soon? I went out and got us a little something
to pump us up.
It's some kinda white powder...
Yeah, I heard it's high-quality shit! One little taste, and you're totally hooked!

H-Hang on, Ryuji! You don't want people
getting the wrong idea...

The hell are you talking about? This is
okonomiyaki mix, dude.

Takoyaki's good and all, but okonomiyaki's
where it's at.

Seein' as we're comin' up on the big finale,
I figured we oughta get ourselves energized.

We'll smack the living piss outta that smug-faced
bastard!

People sometimes jump off this thing during big
celebrations and stuff, right?

Whoa! It's a lot higher than I thought! No one
gets hurt doing this?
My, look at that, [1B]S1.
That is a Japanese puffer fish. You might even call it the Monarch of all puffer fish.
In that case, that fish is our enemy!
Look what I got! Cute, huh?
It's a giant takoyaki pillow...

Interesting. People in Osaka must really know
how to make a sale... Or do they?

Everyone's spreading rumors about us... We're
totally the bad guys here.

They said they'd gimme a good deal, so I kinda
just bought it on the spot...

It's got that regional flair to it, plus I thought
it'd be nice for whenever we're hanging at
the hideout.

We've died and gone to Osaka eats heaven! I'm
gonna have a field day stockin' up for the road.

Whatever, if anything, it just makes me even
more motivated to set things right! We'll expose
Konoe for all he is and put an end to this!

Oh! Isn't this the place where the hero from that
one show gets shot?

I suppose if you were cornered into a narrow
alleyway like that, you wouldn't have many options...
Wait, I know that store! And that one! Wow, they all look exactly the same...

My sixth sense is trying to tell me something...
Yes! The skewers here are marvelous!
Sadly, I've already exhausted my traveling funds... Is this truly the end?

Yusuke seems really sad... I want to be useful.
Think you could help me out, [1B]S1?

I looked up the ingredients for skewers. All we
need to do is gather them and cook some for
him.

Farewell, my sweet pork katsu, beef katsu,
scallop, shrimp, and red ginger combo!

Something tells me you want to eat it for good
luck.
Are you a psychic!?

This puff— I mean—Monarch is quite poisonous.
We must approach it with caution.

You know, now that I think about it, I've been
walking around places I've never been all by
myself...
I asked a lady for directions, AND I talked to a guy selling takoyaki!
You've really grown up.
That's the power of Osaka.
Heheh... I'm not the same ol' Futaba anymore, you know.

Yeah! People here are suuuper friendly! It's
doing wonders for my charisma stats.

Maybe I should try navigating in an Osaka
dialect? Movin' and groovin', Joker! That's muh
boy!

Look how carefully he's flipping the takoyaki...
